creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
JMeter should record the server's response during proxy recording. Two reasons:

1. For the future, JMeter could use such results to "figure out" the dynamic
aspects of the test
2.  The entire recording can be saved and examined later by someone in a remote
location who could theoretically use the information to  modify the recorded
script as necessary to account for dynamic data.

creator: sergey.pomytkin@attws.com
text: In general recording results might be handy for regression tests

creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
text:
A basic version of the include controller has been implemented and checked into
CVS. It should be in today's nightly build. The current implementation does not
show the requests in the included .jmx file. it dynamically loads the partial
chunk and adds it at runtime. More time is needed to figure out to display the
included controller and requests.

ideally, jmeter should allow users to edit those .jmx chunks directly and have
it update the original file. that kind of ability would be nice to have, but
rather than implement something poorly, I decided to implement a simple version
for now.
